meanings.definition: To transfer (a contract or obligation) to another party.
meanings.sent1: She novated her lease agreement to her friend when she moved out.
meanings.sent2: The company novated the project to a different team for completion.
meanings.sent3: The student novated his homework assignment to his little brother as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility was novated to the new employee, shifting the workload.
meanings.sent5: The chef novated the recipe to include healthier ingredients.
